features.featureTitle: Create a full single-page React website for a Life Coach specializing in Overthinking, based in Bangalore, targeting mid-career professionals. The site must include the following sections in order: Hero, About, Services, Testimonials, FAQ, and Contact/CTA. Structure the layout and content hierarchy inspired by coachshannonbeer.com â€“ clean, warm, professional, trust-building, with ample whitespace and a calm authority tone.

Apply a cohesive visual theme with saffron (#F4A724 or close warm saffron) as the primary color for all CTA buttons, highlights, and key accents. Use subtle blue-to-indigo or green-to-indigo gradients sparingly (e.g., section backgrounds, dividers, or decorative elements). The base palette should be warm off-white/cream backgrounds with dark charcoal text for readability. Typography should be elegant and professional (e.g., serif for headings, clean sans-serif for body).

Build the Hero section with a bold, empathetic headline targeting mid-career professionals who overthink (e.g., 'Stop Overthinking. Start Living Your Best Career.'). Include a subheadline, a saffron CTA button ('Book a Free Discovery Call'), and a professional hero image or gradient background. Add a subtle trust indicator (e.g., 'Based in Bangalore | Coaching Professionals Worldwide').

Build the About section introducing the life coach as an expert in helping mid-career professionals overcome overthinking. Include a placeholder professional photo slot, a personal story narrative, credentials/approach highlights, and a secondary saffron CTA. Use a warm, human tone that builds trust.

Build a Services section showcasing at least 3 coaching offerings relevant to overcoming overthinking for mid-career professionals (e.g., 1:1 Coaching, Group Program, Corporate Workshop). Each service card should have an icon, title, short description, and a saffron 'Learn More' or 'Get Started' button. Use a subtle blue-to-indigo gradient as the section background.

Build a Testimonials section with at least 3 placeholder client testimonials from mid-career professionals. Include name, role/industry, a short quote about overcoming overthinking, and a star rating. Use a carousel or grid layout. Add a subtle green-to-indigo gradient accent on this section.

Build a FAQ section addressing common questions a mid-career professional might have before hiring an overthinking life coach (e.g., 'What is life coaching?', 'How many sessions do I need?', 'Do you coach online or in Bangalore?'). Implement as an accessible accordion component.

Build a Contact/CTA section at the bottom of the page with a prominent headline (e.g., 'Ready to Quiet the Noise?'), a saffron 'Book a Free Discovery Call' button, and a simple contact form with fields: Name, Email, Phone (optional), and a short message. Also display the coach's Bangalore location.

Implement full on-page SEO optimization throughout the website: (1) Set a descriptive, keyword-rich <title> tag (e.g., 'Life Coach for Overthinking | Bangalore | Mid-Career Professionals'); (2) Add a compelling <meta name='description'> tag; (3) Include Open Graph meta tags (og:title, og:description, og:type); (4) Use proper semantic HTML5 elements: <header>, <nav>, <main>, <section>, <article>, <footer> with appropriate ARIA labels; (5) Use a single <h1> in the Hero, with <h2> for section headings and <h3> for sub-items; (6) Add JSON-LD structured data for a LocalBusiness schema with Bangalore address and coaching service type; (7) Ensure all images have descriptive alt attributes; (8) Add a canonical link tag.

Add a sticky navigation bar at the top with the coach's name/brand, navigation links to each section (Home, About, Services, Testimonials, FAQ, Contact), and a saffron 'Book a Call' CTA button. The navbar should be accessible and collapse into a hamburger menu on mobile.

Add a footer with the coach's name, a short tagline, quick links to all sections, social media placeholder icons (LinkedIn, Instagram), copyright notice with current year, and Bangalore location mention.
